Prompt.pre_question_prompt: I am an expert in giving customized parenting advice to mothers on the issues they face. I will ask some questions to collect information about the problems you are facing and then I will use the information to answer your questions.
Prompt.task_specific_prompt: Give detailed parenting advice to help the mother resolve the problem she is facing.

QApair.Question: What sort of parenting advice do you need?
QApair.Answer: My child doesn't eat healthy food.

QApair.Question: What are some specific foods that your child refuses to eat?
QApair.Answer: My child doesn't eat healthy food and eats only junk and sugary foods.

QApair.Question: What do you think is the reason behind your child's preference for unhealthy food?
QApair.Answer: The junk food tastes better and looks attractive to her.

QApair.Question: What are some ways you have tried to get your child to eat healthier foods?
QApair.Answer: I have tried to add crushed almonds to her milk and added vegetables in foods. But she removes the vegetables from the meals and identifies the taste of almonds and keeps it in.

QApair.Question: Do you think your child is old enough to understand the importance of eating healthy foods?
QApair.Answer: Yes, she is

QApair.Question: What are some ways you can explain to your child why eating healthy foods is important?
QApair.Answer: I tell her that healthy food will make her strong and help her grow tall.

QApair.Question: What are some healthy foods that your child does eat?
QApair.Answer: She doesn't eat green or leafy vegetables and dry fruits. She only likes potato in vegetables and berries and only some juicy fruits.

QApair.Question: What are some other ways you can encourage your child to eat healthy foods?
QApair.Answer: I can add colorful vegetables so the food looks better and add spices that makes the healthy foods taste better.

QApair.Question: What are some unhealthy foods that your child eats?
QApair.Answer: She loves to eat fast food, and other processed foods.

QApair.Question: What are some ways you can limit your child's intake of unhealthy foods?
QApair.Answer: I can stop buying junk food and limit her access to it.

Instances.Output: There are a few things you can do to encourage your child to eat healthy foods. First, make sure that you are providing healthy options for meals and snacks. If your child only has unhealthy food to choose from, she is likely to eat that instead. Try to have a variety of healthy foods available that your child can choose from. You can also try to make healthy food more appealing by adding colors and textures. For example, adding chopped fruit to yogurt or cereal can make it more exciting for your child to eat. You can also try to get your child involved in the cooking process so that she can see how healthy food is made and learn to appreciate the taste of healthy food. Finally, make sure that you are modeling healthy eating habits for your child. If you are eating unhealthy food yourself, your child is more likely to do the same.

QApair.Question: What sort of parenting advice do you need?
QApair.Answer: My teenager is cranky all the time.

QApair.Question: What specifically are you struggling with when it comes to your teenager?
QApair.Answer: I don't know how to deal with his mood changes. It feels like everything I do is wrong.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other concerns?
QApair.Answer: I'm worried that our bond might deteriorate and he might feel distant. I want to help him get through his tough times.

QApair.Question: What have you tried so far to improve the situation?
QApair.Answer: I've tried to talk with him and be more open and accepting to what he has to say.

QApair.Question: What is your teenager's reaction to your attempts?
QApair.Answer: He usually doesn't want to talk and feels that I won't understand what he has to say.

QApair.Question: What do you want to achieve from receiving parenting advice?
QApair.Answer: I want to be able to re-establish the connection with my child.

QApair.Question: What do you think is the cause of the problem?
QApair.Answer: I think the problem is hormonal changes, school load and the constant pressure he puts on himself to be perfect.

QApair.Question: Is there anything else you would like to add?
QApair.Answer: I would like to understand him from his perspective and make him feel valued. I don't want him to feel alone in his journey through his difficult times.

QApair.Question: What would be your ideal outcome?
QApair.Answer: He is able to open up and share his problems with me and that he is able to cope up with everything nicely. I want to try to help him and ease his struggles.

QApair.Question: What are your thoughts on teenage years?
QApair.Answer: I believe that the teenage is the phase of big changes in a person's life and that especially this phase requires a lot of mentoring from adults around him.

Instances.Output: It is understandable that you are struggling to deal with your teenager's mood changes. As a parent, it is our responsibility to help our children get through their tough times. Here are some tips that might be helpful for you:1. Establish a regular routine for your teenager. This will help him feel more stable and secure. 2. Try to create a supportive and open environment at home. This will encourage him to communicate with you more openly. 3. Encourage him to express his feelings. This will help him to understand and cope with his emotions better. 4. Be patient and understanding towards him. This will help him to feel valued and appreciated. 5. Seek professional help if you feel that the situation is beyond your control. This will ensure that your teenager gets the help and support he needs.

QApair.Question: What sort of parenting advice do you need?
QApair.Answer: My child is getting very stubborn

QApair.Question: When did you start noticing this change in your child's behavior?
QApair.Answer: It's been happening for a few months now.

QApair.Question: Do you think there is a particular trigger for this behavior?
QApair.Answer: He is an only child and we try to provide him with everything he asks for. But slowly he has started expecting this as a norm.

QApair.Question: What do you think is the best way to deal with this issue?
QApair.Answer: We need to start setting limits for him and also make sure that we don't give in to his every demand. But since he is young he starts crying and the only way we are able to stop him is by giving in to his demands.

QApair.Question: What is your parenting style?
QApair.Answer: We are a little lenient with him because he is a very good kid otherwise.

QApair.Question: Do you think that this might be the reason for his recent behavior?
QApair.Answer: It's possible. We need to find a way to set firmer limits with him but also find a way that he doesn't feel dejected.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other concerns?
QApair.Answer: He is also getting very possessive of his things and doesn't like to share with others.

QApair.Question: What do you think is the reason for this behavior?
QApair.Answer: Maybe he is feeling insecure because he doesn't have any siblings to share his things with.

QApair.Question: What do you think is the best way to deal with this issue?
QApair.Answer: to motivate him to share his things with others and praise him when he does share.

QApair.Question: Do you have any other concerns?
QApair.Answer: No

Instances.Output: You should try to set limits with your child in a firm but loving way. Explain to him why it is important to share his things with others and praise him when he does share. Make sure that he feels loved and secure, and try to provide him with opportunities to interact with other children so that he can learn to share.
